revised_title: Tissue Interaction Models for Spatial Pattern Generation in Skin
tldr: This article explores the role of tissue interaction in the generation of spatial patterns in skin development. The authors introduce two tissue interaction models and examine the bifurcations from simple to complex patterns. They demonstrate that tissue interaction is essential for understanding the complexity of spatial structure and the sequential patterning in skin development. The models consider different types of interaction between the dermis and epidermis, including chemical, mechanical, and electrical signals.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
